terms.definition: Standard Operating Procedure - a detailed, written instruction to achieve uniformity in the performance of specific functions or processes
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code, ensuring users always access the most current approved version
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Written materials that explain how to use, maintain, or understand technical products, processes, or systems
Computer Numerical Control - automated control of machining tools through computer programming for precise manufacturing
Computer-Aided Manufacturing - software used to control machine tools and related machinery in manufacturing processes
An international standard that specifies requirements for quality management systems in organizations
A chronological record of system activities that provides documentary evidence of the sequence of activities affecting a document or process
Groups of people with different functional expertise working toward a common goal, such as engineering, production, and quality assurance teams
A single, unified system where all related information, tools, or processes are stored and managed from one location
Failure Mode and Effects Analysis - a systematic method for evaluating processes to identify where and how they might fail
Statistical Process Control - a method of quality control using statistical methods to monitor and control manufacturing processes
The process of ensuring that an organization adheres to laws, regulations, guidelines, and specifications relevant to its business
Detailed, step-by-step guidance that tells workers exactly how to perform specific tasks or operations
A virtual representation of a physical object or process that is used for simulation, monitoring, and analysis
